title: Oscars 2017: Viola Davis shines on red carpet | Daily Mail Online
text: comments She is up for her third Academy Award . And Viola Davis, who is nominated for Best Supporting actress for her role in Fences, made sure to come in looking like a winner on Sunday night with a brand new bob. The 51-year-old actress looked gorgeous and glowing in an Armani Privé vermillion red silk cady gown as she showed off her new haircut. Scroll down for video Winner: Viola Davis had another red carpet win as she stunned in a red Armani Privé off-the-shoulder gown Fringe appeal: The 51-year-old actress looked gorgeous and glowing as she rocked a new short cut with full bangs concealing her forehead Viola is nominated for her part in Fences, going up for the Oscar for Actress in a Supporting Role against Naomie Harris in Moonlight, Nicole Kidman in Lion, Octavia Spencer in Hidden Figures and Michelle Williams in Manchester by the Sea The drama - starring Denzel Washington alongside Viola - is also up for Motion Picture of the year.
